dataList.dlg: Your problems...will be dealt with posthaste.
Faust doesn't particularly enjoy train rides. In a trip, it doesn't always have to be the body that moves from one place to another.
It's important to see through the essence of things. For instance, your clock isn't really a clock, and WARP trains don't exactly warp.
Don't let rumors slip under your notice, Dante. All rumors start from a crumb of truth.
To tell you the truth, Faust did not enjoy cleaning. It was the opposite, rather.
Does the end really justify the means? Is the excruciating pain you bear really worth bringing them back?
You don't seem to be as inquisitive of your situation compared to me. Or, have you decided to accept it?
One day, I plan to collect all secrets of the City and paint them all on a canvas. It'll be something to appreciate.
Faust likes to travel from place to place. There is no better occupation than this in that regard.
...They apparently disappear without notice on occasion. End of log.
I'm starting to get a good grasp of this place.
Got it, let's move.
Faust, commencing battle.
I'm rather busy at the moment.
I'll make quick work of them.
Weakness noted.
Tch!
Job's done.
This is why I dislike trains.
Faust, mission accomplished.
Perhapse we were too hasty?
Let's try and make it quicker next time.
Faust, reporting in with another flawless success.
Some personnel made unnecessary movement.
